page.title: 13Lower Denby Area
page.content: Lower Denby is now a{small hamlet comprising mainly of private houses and cottages surrounded by farmland. Some of the houses are very old being originally weavers cottages, a smithy and a small village school. One of the large houses in the area was built by Sir Zachariah Hinchliffe who founded the cloth mills in Denby Dale and was knighted for the excellence of his cloth that was sent to the Crimean War. The parkland that he created is now used for cattle grazing. The pub at the junction of 5 roads changed its name in 1984 from The Junction to The Dunkirk which is the local name for the road junction. The house called Papist Hall was originally called Papist Hill Farm and legend says that there is a{secret passage}from this house to Gunthwaite Hall.
